briefdescription.para: Initial gain used during the initialisation.
Initialisation period in seconds.
Returns the direction of gravity scaled by 0.5.
Returns the direction of the magnetic field scaled by 0.5.

simplesect.para: Direction of the magnetic field scaled by 0.5.

briefdescription.para: Returns the feedback.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int value, const int min, const int max)
memberdef.name: Clamp

briefdescription.para: Returns a value limited to maximum and minimum.

simplesect.para: Value limited to maximum and minimum.

briefdescription.para: Initialises the AHRS algorithm structure.
Resets the AHRS algorithm. This is equivalent to reinitialising the algorithm while maintaining the current settings.
Sets the AHRS algorithm settings.

briefdescription.para: Updates the AHRS algorithm using the gyroscope, accelerometer, and magnetometer measurements.

parameterdescription.para: Gyroscope measurement in degrees per second.

memberdef.argsstring: (FusionAhrs *const ahrs, const FusionVector gyroscope, const FusionVector accelerometer, const float deltaTime)

parameterdescription.para: Gyroscope measurement in degrees per second.

briefdescription.para: Updates the AHRS algorithm using the gyroscope, accelerometer, and heading measurements.

parameterdescription.para: Gyroscope measurement in degrees per second.

briefdescription.para: Returns the quaternion describing the sensor relative to the Earth.

simplesect.para: Quaternion describing the sensor relative to the Earth.

briefdescription.para: Sets the quaternion describing the sensor relative to the Earth.

parameterdescription.para: Quaternion describing the sensor relative to the Earth.

briefdescription.para: Returns the linear acceleration measurement equal to the accelerometer measurement with the 1 g of gravity removed.
Returns the Earth acceleration measurement equal to accelerometer measurement in the Earth coordinate frame with the 1 g of gravity removed.
Returns the AHRS algorithm internal states.
Returns the AHRS algorithm flags.
Sets the heading of the orientation measurement provided by the AHRS algorithm. This function can be used to reset drift in heading when the AHRS algorithm is being used without a magnetometer.
AHRS algorithm to combine gyroscope, accelerometer, and magnetometer measurements into a single measurement of orientation relative to the Earth.
